result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jhoan Jose Villanueva Rendon

records.addlTxt:
9:44 AM Defendant Jhoan Jose Villanueva Rendon in court.  Attorney Peter C Lloyd c in court for Jhoan Jose Villanueva Rendon.  District Attorney (DA) Cass Cousins appears on behalf of Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil for State of Wisconsin. Interpreter, Enrique Soria, appears in person.

Court calls the case.
DA Cousins states the appearances. 

9:45 a.m.  Interpreter is sworn in by the Clerk.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.
DA Cousins states that a PTC will be conducted today and hearing set.
Atty Lloyd informs the Court that the next PTC is set for 12/05/22.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Interpreter will not be needed for 12/05/22
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Request for Substitution of Judge. Filed by Atty Soule.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.

4:11 PM Defendant Jhoan Jose Villanueva Rendon in court.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Jhoan Jose Villanueva Rendon.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Enrique Soria is sworn in and interprets for court.
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Arraignment scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Arraignment on October 17, 2022 at 10:30 am. Interpreter will be present.
Pre-trial conference on October 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for 09/19/22 @ 2:30 p.m. in Br 2
No contact with Walmart in Plover

1:06 PM Defendant David Salas Mercado and Jhoan Villanueba Rendon in court.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil in court for State of WI. Cases are called together.  Interpreter Susan Rascon is sworn in and interprets for the court and defendants.
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Susan appears on behalf of the defendant.
ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Retail Theft for Villanueba and Party to Retail Theft for Salas Mercado. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendants committed it.
Court informs defendants of the right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendants are  eligible for public defender representation.
State requests a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated for each defendant.
Attorney for the defendants does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
